comments:
when debugging a target eclipse I found that if you happen to have a null selection in the launch view fo your host, debugging in the target will throw alot of the following error:

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.launch.LaunchView$ContextProvider.possibleContextChange(LaunchView.java:170)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.launch.LaunchView.possibleContextChange(LaunchView.java:434)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.views.launch.LaunchViewUpdatePolicy.handleState(LaunchViewUpdatePolicy.java:44)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.viewers.TreeUpdatePolicy.updateNodes(TreeUpdatePolicy.java:63)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.viewers.TreeUpdatePolicy.updateNodes(TreeUpdatePolicy.java:72)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.viewers.TreeUpdatePolicy.updateNodes(TreeUpdatePolicy.java:72)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.viewers.TreeUpdatePolicy.updateNodes(TreeUpdatePolicy.java:72)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.model.viewers.TreeUpdatePolicy.modelChanged(TreeUpdatePolicy.java:32)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.provisional.AbstractModelProxy$1.run(AbstractModelProxy.java:70)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.provisional.AbstractModelProxy.fireModelChanged(AbstractModelProxy.java:74)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.update.DebugEventHandler.fireDelta(DebugEventHandler.java:164)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.update.ThreadEventHandler.fireDeltaAndClearTopFrame(ThreadEventHandler.java:141)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.update.ThreadEventHandler.handleCreate(ThreadEventHandler.java:104)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.update.EventHandlerModelProxy.dispatchCreate(EventHandlerModelProxy.java:170)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.viewers.update.EventHandlerModelProxy.handleDebugEvents(EventHandlerModelProxy.java:132)
	at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin$EventNotifier.run(DebugPlugin.java:1083)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.SafeRunner.run(SafeRunner.java:37)
	at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin$EventNotifier.dispatch(DebugPlugin.java:1115)
	at org.eclipse.debug.core.DebugPlugin$EventDispatchJob.run(DebugPlugin.java:344)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:58)

Created an attachment (id=34571)
screenshot

the attachment is a screenshot of the null selection in the host.

added in a simple null check in LaunchView#possibleContextChange

fixed in HEAD
I don't think fProvider can ever be null - it's assigned on object creation and never changed.
Yes, I am strongly believing that the aforementioned fix is not the reason I can no longer produce this error, needs more investigation.

after some investigation it was discovered that this problem comes from a bug in the way we were allowing TreeSelections to be created. 

Currently we allow paths that have no segments to be added to a list of viable paths in a tree selection. This means we can have a selection of size n, but the treepaths contained in the selection could have no segments.

fixed in TreeSelection constructor, in HEAD
